title: [Placements] saw this stats on counseling presentation
content: just wanted to share for info~

comments.body: Median being higher than avg is interesting
1843(total) - 861(placed) - 373(higher studies) = 609 (unplaced) ?
Internship offers are included in no of people placed?
Isn't that a good thing?

It means there are few people with low salaries pulling the median down.
Which is weird cause it's the other way around normally
I tried calculating using llms each time median was higher than avg so that's not rigged
there are even students whose data is not mentioned in the slide. The ones who don't have the required gpa to sit for placements.
This only increases the number of unplaced students ü•≤

ik that's why I mentioned it
you are in 2nd year so i hope you have better about me about how things work ?? so is it really like many people don't get placed???

I'm entering 2nd year and whether or not there are so many unplaced studets is not obvious to me... you will have to ask 3rd or 4th year seniors.. that was why I also added a question mark in the end lol
ooh ok
I have no idea , tho I ll be joining this yearüò∫
i mean the job market is pretty shit so it makes sense that ppl would have taken up any job offer they got even if low paying
So around 430 students got a package of more than 13 lakhs, Damnn!
563 got Tier 1
What is tier 1 offer in PESU?
12+ LPA
Afaik pesu is a very good college in bangalore and its median ctc is around 13-14lpa, then how the hell IIITB getting an median of 33lpa?
Lower intake. Better quality students¬†
Iiitb have 120 CSE students only that‚Äôs why
are those stats even real? like I've seen some IITs stats those are very similar (IITs stats were even better than this)
but 120 is less?
In pes this no. Is more than 1000

No one can know for sure since it's a private university. But since it's only CSE and ECE, their stats are definitely gonna be better. And Bangalore location advantage and the fact that IIITB does not have only Btech, it's Integrated 5 year MTech which means students get to specialize more and also become more valuable in the industry.
isn't this no is very high? like iits/nits also have about 80-100 seats in each branch

they have btech programs too, but is it worth to join that? Or should I go with my state govt college?   
Tbh idk much about these things
Avg of top 100 in pes may be 20+
If you have IIITB as an option, I dont see why you should not join

I'm getting BTech (DSAI) there but my concern is fees (will cost me around 26-27 lakhs including everything) and my state govt clg (NSUT) will cost me around 14-15 lakhs. My parents are ready to pay this but it should it worth it atleast
Wasn't De Shaw internship stipend 1.5 lpm
bro wtf imagine comparing iit nit and iiits to a private college
sorry bro as I earlier said Idk much about these things (sorry if I said anything wrong)

IIITB easy. Your internship stipend itself will be 1 to 2L a month. You can make back the money in 5 years max. Plus Delhi pollution. Bangalore weather is much better. Job opportunities are better. and you get the IIIT tag which will help in future.
It'll be 35+ lol
What's the usual gpa requirement
It is 2 lpm right now

Juniors, the 56LPA offer is not actually 56. 

56 will be the 4TH YEAR‚Äôs CTC if you hang on to zomato till then. It‚Äôs misleading.

If you have more than 7 you'll be eligible for internship and placements, but the companies might add their own CGPA requirements.

So having 8.5+ increase your chances by quite a lot.

But I think 8.5 is safe.
That 56lpa will be meüîùü•∞
But still 24l base is a lot
my jee %ile is 99.52 any other good option u would like to give?
Woah that's an amazing percentile. I think NITK ECE, AIML, Data Science might be a good option. I hope you have finished JOSAA counselling. Also IIITB registrations are done.

I was not getting anything (AIML,DS,ECE) I'm from Gen category and other state so I was only getting NITK EEE üò≠  
Yup I've registered for all my friends told me about where to register for
NITK EEE is also good. Go for it.
Bro ig in these stats ppos aren't incl right?
They don't include ppos and off campus placements

Firstly PPO's that are offered through on campus internships are counted

Secondly the number of off campus placements cancels out the number of ineligible students

Hence the final figure 609 remains more or less the same

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1SnSNM_GnuTwIJ0oI3bHt9nAnDQXfqwIhT8JHEwq727g/edit?usp=drivesdk but bro tier 1 2 3 incl gives 872 offers not even including ppos from summer and spring internship
Genuine question- does pes include ppos in there placement stats which have been offered on campus?

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1SnSNM_GnuTwIJ0oI3bHt9nAnDQXfqwIhT8JHEwq727g/edit?usp=drivesdk tier 1 2 3 incl gives 872 offers not even including ppos from summer and spring internship (I am having difficulty understanding there placement stats) and they have shown 861 which is close to tier 1 2 3 offers combined and excludes ppos from spring and summer internships ig

Hmm your right:

So maybe a possible explanation is

904(FTE offers)+536(Internship only offers)

But in the sheet as its maintained by students not very accurate:

830(FTE offers)+398(Internship only offers)
